page.title: 02MARSH ECOLOGY
page.content: The drainage dykes of the Chislet Marshes derive their water from the Wantsum, Sarre Penn, and small streams draining the Highstead terrace. The clear slightly alkaline water supports {FISH:}Eels,Pike,Rudd,Tench, and sometimes Flounders penetrate from the sea.These fish lie up in deep holes, coming out at night to feed. Crayfish and Fresh Water Mussels are also found.{ANIMALS:}Foxes, Hares, Rabbits, Hedgehogs,Rats, Voles, Moles, Lizards, Toads, and 55 species of snail.{BIRDS: All the common British birds of marsh and shore.At this time 400 Brent Geese are wintering there.The marsh is a major stop-over for migrants.In 1978 a pair of Common Bustards were observed.
